column1: marco-linders,Marco,Linders,Senior Project Manager & Research Scientist at TNO | Energy & Materials Transition | Biogas | CO2 capture | CO2 Utilisation | Hydrogen production,https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C5603AQHRynplg-GSWQ/profile-displayphoto-shrink_800_800/0/1516304373840?e=1697673600&v=beta&t=d-02s2vU1a7IiCJdDKpS2BFal7cVk_jWloPgCPpALLI,,personal,ACoAAAFBHzMBIbGyZxdEcD0miP2Zh-nRrngz0Ok,21045043,,"Currently I’m working as senior research scientist as well as project manager at TNO, department Sustainable Process and Energy Systems ‘SPES’. I’m involved in technology developments that support the energy transition and reduce CO2 emissions that cause climate change. Some focus areas are:

column2: Molten metal methane pyrolysis to produce hydrogen and solid carbon;
Production of syngas (CO/H2) through solid oxide electrolysis;
Novel reactor concepts to produce synthetic fuels like methanol and DME;

column1: In the past I have been working for TNO Defence, Security and Safety for almost 10 years, on adsorption processes, characterization of porous materials, and individual protective equipment against chemical and biological warfare agents.

Specialties: Synthetic fuels, molten metal pyrolysis, CO2 capture, gas treatment, biogas upgrading, adsorption processes, characterization of porous materials, numerical modelling, computer programming (Fortran, Delphi)","{'country': 'Netherlands', 'short': 'The Randstad, Netherlands', 'city': 'The Randstad', 'state': 'Netherlands', 'default': 'The Randstad, White, encourages scientific or application-oriented research in the field of respiratory protection. White Award for 2003 is Breakthrough of Shallow Activated Carbon Beds Under Constant and Pulsating Flow by M.J.G. Linders, E.P.J. Mallens, J.J.G.M. van Bokhoven, F. Kapteijn, and J.A. Moulijn, published in the March/April 2003 AIHA Journal, volume 64, p. 173.', 'issuer': 'AIHA Respiratory Protection Committee', 'date': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}}]","[{'name': 'Certified Project Management Associate', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'authority': 'International Project Management Association (IPMA-NL)', 'url': None, 'license_number': None, 'display_source': None, 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'International Project Management Association (IPMA-NL)', 'logo': None, 'url': None}}]",[],"[{'title': 'Renewable Gas – Mobile Biogas Laboratory for Belize', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'TNO has designed and delivered a mobile biogas laboratory in Belize for the Caribbean Community Climate Change Center (CCCCC). This project is the first step towards a controlled introduction of biogas systems in Belize and knowledge exchange with staff and students from the university of Belize. The long term goal of this collaboration is to combat climate change and contribute to a sustainable clean energy supply. The movable, robust, easy to use biogas lab will be used to select and test the potential of suitable local biomasses for biogas production.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marco', 'last_name': 'Linders', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Project Manager & Research Scientist at TNO | Energy & Materials Transition | Biogas | CO2 capture | CO2 Utilisation | Hydrogen production'}]}, {'title': 'Development and demonstration of a highly selective and cost effective terpene removal system for biogas', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The aim of this project is to develop a terpene removal system that reduces costs for biogas producers, prevents problems in the biogas production chain and gives insight in the valorization of terpenes. This technology is based on regenerative selective chemical absorption using affinity based extractants. The current methods available are costly and lead to additional safety risks.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marco', 'last_name': 'Linders', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Project Manager & Research Scientist at TNO | Energy & Materials Transition | Biogas | CO2 capture | CO2 Utilisation | Hydrogen production'}]}, {'title': 'HiPerCap: Developing Breakthrough Technologies for the future post-combustion CO2 capture plants', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'HiPerCap aims to develop novel post-combustion CO2 capture technologies and processes which are environmentally benign and have high potential to lead to breakthroughs in energy consumption and overall cost. The project includes all main separation technologies for post-combustion CO2 capture; absorption, adsorption and membranes. For each technology the project is focusing on a chosen set of promising concepts. A key focus in HiPerCap is to demonstrate the potential of different capture technologies and compare the technologies on a fair basis.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marco', 'last_name': 'Linders', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Project Manager & Research Scientist at TNO | Energy & Materials Transition | Biogas | CO2 capture | CO2 Utilisation | Hydrogen production'}]}, {'title': 'Increased energy efficiency for amine scrubbing systems resulting in an increase of green gas production', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'To produce sustainable natural gas (green gas) from biogas, it has to be upgraded to meet the grid entry specifications. The operating costs in a biogas upgrading plant are an important part of the total costs of green gas production. This project aims to reduce the operating costs of biogas upgrading and increase green gas production, by developing and demonstrating an improved regeneration technology. This will improve the business case for green gas production and will contribute to the realization of new green gas initiatives, and therefore increase the green gas production.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marco', 'last_name': 'Linders', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Project Manager & Research Scientist at TNO | Energy & Materials Transition | Biogas | CO2 capture | CO2 Utilisation | Hydrogen production'}]}]","[{'name': 'Demonstration of CO2 capture for flue gas of a glass factory', 'publisher': 'NPT Procestechnologie', 'url': None, 'date': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'authors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marco', 'last_name': 'Linders', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Project Manager & Research Scientist at TNO | Energy & Materials Transition | Biogas | CO2 capture | CO2 Utilisation | Hydrogen production'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Arjen', 'last_name': 'Huizinga', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Researcher / Process Engineer at TNO'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Earl', 'last_name': 'Goetheer', 'name': None, 'headline': 'CTO at High Tech XL, Part time full professor  at Technical University of Delft'}]}, {'name': 'Exploratory Investigation of the Risk of Desorption from Activated Carbon Filters in Respiratory Protective Devices', 'publisher': 'Industrial & Engineering Chemistry Research', 'url': None, 'date': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'authors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marco', 'last_name': 'Linders', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Project Manager & Research Scientist at TNO | Energy & Materials Transition | Biogas | CO2 capture | CO2 Utilisation | Hydrogen production'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'P.J. 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': 'Topics currently involved are:\n• Sustainable bioenergy/biomass refinery: ranging from biomass conversion techniques (such as gasification, super critical water gasification, fermentation), biomass pretreatment techniques to improve the conversion process or yield, to gas treatment to match the required product specifications.\n• Value chain analysis from feedstock to product, for example lignocellulosic based biomass to chemicals, algae to chemicals and fuels.\n• Chain analysis of biomass to biogas conversion for the applications power/heat production, transportation fuel (liquefied methane), synthetic natural gas – steps, costs and margins.\n• Upgrading biogas, i.e. the removal of carbon dioxide (CO2) and hydrogen sulphide (H2S) using various techniques, amongst others adsorptive processes and membrane technology.\n• Development of hybrid materials – combining adsorption and membrane technology in one material; applications: H2/CO2 separation (precombustion; gas treatment), CO2 & H2S / CH4 separation (biogas upgrading), CO2 & SO2 / air separation (combustion).\n• Membrane Gas Absorption (MGA) technique for gas treatment in general; more specifically for flue gas desulphurization and CO2 capture for small scale applications (not power sector).\n• Development of a three phase slurry process (gas-liquid-solid) to remove CO2 from flue gas: applying amine functionalized polymer resin adsorbents.\n• Development of a CO2 buffer system for CO2 supply to greenhouses based on adsorption technology; CO2 separated from WKK flue gas.', 'title': 'Senior Research Scientist', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Rijswijk, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': '• Expertise in: adsorption processes, characterization of porous materials, and individual protective equipment against chemical warfare agents. As a senior research scientist involved in research on new adsorption materials and air purification processes with special attention to Toxic Industrial Chemicals, development of innovative collective protection systems, and development of simulation models for BC-protective equipment.\n• Involved in national and international Defence and European projects, for example ESLI – End of Service Life Indicator (MoD – UK), Network of Excellence ‘InsidePores’ (EU FP6), FRESP – Advanced first response respiratory protection (EU FP7).\n• Delegation leader of the ANNCP – Anglo-Netherlands-Norwegian Working Group II, Chemical and Biological Defence, CP II-4: Protection and Decontamination.', 'title': 'Senior Research Scientist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company':
